questions.question_text: The administrator wants to track data over a period of time. Which graph would he use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
E is the correct Answer.
Explanation ; A folder is a place where you can store reports, dashboards, documents, or email templates. Folders can be public, hidden, or shared, and can be set to read-only or read/write. You control who has access to its contents based on roles, permissions, public groups, and license types. You can make a folder available to your entire organization, or make it private so that only the owner has access.
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.customize_folders.htm&type=5

questions.question_text: Folders are used to organize the following (Choose all that apply.)
What is true about Lead Assignment Rule?

choices.B: Contains Rule Entries, pre-defined business rules, that determine lead routing
choices.A: Determines how Leads are automatically routed to User or Queue
choices.C: Virtual storage bin used to group leads based on criteria (e.g., industry, campaign)
choices.D: Users have visibility into the Lead Queues to which they are members

questions.question_text: Select all which are true about Contacts Objects

discussion.content: The answer here should be ABC.

Your contacts might work with more than one company. A business owner might own more than one company or a consultant might work on behalf of multiple organizations. Your relationships may be complicated, but keeping tabs on them doesn’t need to be.

When you relate a single contact to multiple accounts you can easily track the relationships between people and businesses without creating duplicate records. The relationship rules are still simple. Every contact needs to be associated with a primary account. This is the account that appears in Account Name and is usually the company the contact is most closely associated with. Any other accounts associated with the contact represent indirect relationships. The Related Contacts list lets you view current and past relationships, and capture unique and custom details about these relationships so you always know who you’re talking to—or who you should be talking to.

choices.B: Has to be associated with an Account
choices.D: One Account can have multiple Contacts
choices.C: One contact can belong to multiple Accounts
choices.A: Can be associated with an Account

questions.question_text: The _______ determines if a user can read, create and edit Contact records, the __________ determines if he can see/edit contact records owned by his subordinates.

discussion.content: I dont think it's a suitable ans
Can someone tell why D is the answer?

comments.content: Profile determine CRED whether they can create, read, edit or delete a record. As the following sentence subordinates can view which mean is hierarchy which is set up roles
Sharing rules cannot give Create permission. They apply on existing records.
